required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This study assesses whether a computerized intervention can be used to decrease perceived hostility in hostile individuals.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will investigate whether a brief computerized intervention can decrease perceived hostility of interpersonal situations. Participants will be randomized into an active treatment or control condition. We hypothesize that participants in the treatment condition will have lower perceived hostility at post treatment than those in the waitlist condition.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomized into active treatment or control condition.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will not know what condition they are assigned to.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Cook Medley Hostility Inventory
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one hour, one week, one month
primary_outcome.description: Self-report measure assessing hostility using a true/false scale with higher scores indicating higher levels of hostility.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Word Sentence Association Paradigm-Hostility
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one hour, one week, one month
primary_outcome.description: Self-report measure assessing hostility using a 6-point scale with higher scores indicating higher levels of hostile interpretation bias.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one hour, one week, one month
primary_outcome.description: Self-report measure assessing symptoms of alcohol use disorder with higher scores indicating more severe symptoms.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one hour, one week, one month
primary_outcome.description: Self-report measure assessing motives for drinking, including social, recreational, and coping. Higher scores indicate greater likelihood of drinking for each motive.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one hour, one week, one month
primary_outcome.description: Participants will provide the number of standard drinks of alcohol they drank each day in the past month.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Self Stigma of Seeking Help
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one hour, one week, one month
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report measure assessing stigma associated with seeking help for psychological problems. Higher scores indicate greater negative attitudes toward psychosocial treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Perceived Stigma and Barriers to Care for Psychological Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one hour, one week, one month
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report measure assessing stigma associated with seeking help for psychological problems. Higher scores indicate greater negative attitudes toward psychosocial treatment.

arm_group.description: Computerized intervention aimed at reducing perceived hostility.
Computerized intervention aimed at increasing overall physical health.

intervention.description: Intervention designed to build social support and reduce loneliness by giving participants skills to strengthen their relationships
Intervention designed to improve physical health through exercise, eating habits, and sleep

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Increased hostility based on the Buss Perry Aggression Questionnaire
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
